title: 105_hr3623
content:
The Capital Gains Tax Simplification Act of 1998 introduces a new section, SEC. 1203, which allows for a capital gains deduction. The Capital Gains Tax Simplification Act of 1998 introduces a new section, SEC. 1203, allowing a 40 percent deduction from gross income for net capital gains for non-corporate taxpayers. This deduction is applicable regardless of whether the taxpayer itemizes other deductions. Additionally, the Act repeals the tax preference for exclusion on small business stock. Repeal of Tax Preference for Exclusion on Small Business Stock and Technical Changes:
- Section 57(a)(7) is repealed.
- Section 53(d)(1)(B)(ii) is amended to remove references to paragraphs (5) and (7).
- Section 1(h) and section 55(b)(3) are struck.
- Section 163(d)(4)(E) is amended for coordination with capital gains deduction. Section 170(e)(1) is amended to include 60 percent (100 percent for corporations) of the amount of gain. Section 172(d)(2)(B) excludes the deduction under sections 1202 and 1203. Section 453A(c)(3) now considers the maximum rate on net capital gain under section 1201 or the deduction under section 1203. Section 641(d)(2)(A) is amended. Section 641(d)(2)(A) is amended to remove certain wording. Section 641(d)(2)(C) is amended to add a new clause. Paragraph (4) of section 642(c) is amended to adjust deductions for capital gains and deductions under sections 1202 and 1203. The amendments in sections 642 and 643 involve deductions for capital gains and adjustments related to sections 1202 and 1203. Outside the United States, gain from the sale or exchange of capital assets is limited to foreign source capital gain net income. Amendments are made to section 904(b)(2) and paragraph (3) of section 904(b) to address these issues. The amendments in sections 642 and 643 involve deductions for capital gains and adjustments related to sections 1202 and 1203. Paragraphs (15) to (17) of the amendments address specific modifications to tax rates and deductions, including changes to the highest rate of tax specified in section 11(b) and adjustments to the deduction provided by section 1203. The tax code amendments involve changes to tax rates and deductions, including increasing the rate from 20% to 23.7%. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for part I of subchapter P of chapter 1. The amendments made by section 1203 include changes to capital gains deduction effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 1998. Withholding amendments apply to amounts paid after the same date. Section 311 of the Taxpayer Relief Act of 1997 is amended, and coordination with a prior transition rule is specified.
